title: Hexadecimal
description: The Hexadecimal is a base-16 number system that uses sixteen digits: 0-9 and A-F, where A-F represent the values 10 to 15.
content: The base-16 number system that includes digits 0-9 and letters A-F, where A-F represent the values 10 to 15. It's commonly used in computing as a shorthand for binary values, as every two hexadecimal digits represent one byte of data.
